title: Fed Officials and Staff Mulled Financial Stability Risks at January FOMC Meeting
sub_head: Minutes show officials weren’t all of one mind regarding risks
body:
The Federal Reserve has, at least for now, traded drama surrounding what may be next for monetary policy for a debate about the stability of the financial system.
In minutes of their Federal Open Market Committee policy meeting in late January, central bank officials offered a range of views showing they weren’t all of one mind regarding financial stability risks, a debate that came even as they said very easy monetary policy will remain in place for quite some time.
The...
